Sensex, Nifty, Share Price LIVE:   Indian markets traded lower on Tuesday despite hopes of a trade deal with the U.S. and firm global cues. At 9:52 a.m., the Sensex fell 258 points to 83,276, while the Nifty dropped 77 points to 25,497.

 
On Monday, U.S. President Donald Trump said that U.S. was close to striking a deal with India to deepen economic and security ties, expand U.S. energy exports and spur investments in key American sectors.

The remarks mark a notable shift after Trump had earlier doubled tariffs on Indian imports to 50% in retaliation against New Delhi's Russian oil purchases

items.title: Delhi airport: Some flights might be impacted amid calibration of runway's instrument landing system

Flights may experience disruptions and schedule changes during this two-hour window. The Indira Gandhi International Airport, a major hub, handles over 1,500 flights daily. This calibration ensures precise aircraft landings.

items.title: Trade talk on table as EAM Jaishankar visits Canada

Discussions will also cover technology, energy, and critical minerals. This visit follows a recent trip by Canada's minister to India. Both nations agreed to begin ministerial-level trade and investment discussions soon.

items.title: India to train 5.7 million workers in mining by 2030 to boost critical minerals push, cut import reliance
items.summary: The mines ministry and the Skill Council for Mining Sector (SCMS), under the Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship, have formed a project steering committee to initiate a skills gap study 2025-30 for the sector across job roles under the National Critical Mineral Mission (NCMM). "The report will come up with a detailed action plan for the sector on ways to impart skills training to millions of workers to cater to the increasing demand from the sector in the near future under the Mission," a senior government official told ET.

items.title: Mining industry flags retrospective impact of new auction rules; govt says aim is to curb hoarding

Jindal Stainless reported strong quarterly earnings, but highlighted the challenge of subsidized imports distorting the market.

items.title: India’s unemployment rate dips to 5.2% in Q2FY26 as rural jobs rise; youth joblessness edges up
items.summary: The figures, based on the current weekly status (CWS), cover individuals aged 15 and above who were unemployed but actively seeking work during the seven days prior to the survey. Youth unemployment (15-29) rose to 14.8% in Q2FY26 from 14.6% in Q1, according to the Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS) quarterly bulletin released by the ministry of statistics and programme implementation (MoSPI). The quarterly survey covered 133,901 households and 564,828 people across rural and urban areas.

The Chinese authority has approved it specifically for the treatment of moderate to severe seasonal allergic rhinitis in adults and pediatric patients six years of age and older, and moderate to severe perennial AR in adults and pediatric patients 12 years of age and older.

items.title: DoCA proposes to mandate searchable filter for country of origin on online platforms
items.summary: The Ministry said that the amendment seeks to empower consumers to make informed purchasing decisions by allowing them to easily identify the origin of products while shopping online

items.title: Gujarat Gas clocks 9.4% decline in net profit for Q2 FY26
items.summary: The company that primarily operates in the segment of natural gas business recorded less than 1% growth in its revenues for the quarter which stood at ₹3979 crore from ₹3949 crore a year earlier

items.title: UCBs’ umbrella body launches digital solutions to strengthen payments infrastructure, automate lending operations
items.summary: The new digital solution is designed to modernise UCB operations and enable them to better serve a new generation of tech-savvy customers

items.title: India-US trade talks: Engineering exporters propose inclusion of steel, aluminium items
items.summary: EEPC suggests EU should be persuaded not to reduce quotas and increase out-of-quota tariffs on steel

items.title: TRAI to review of interconnection regulations; floats discussion paper
items.summary: Telecom regulator TRAI is reviewing all nine interconnection regulations. Stakeholder views are sought on satellite-based networks and IP interconnection. The review aims to adapt to technological evolution. Various charges and frameworks are under examination. TRAI is also looking at international models for adaptation in India. The regulator seeks input on security provisions and charges for international calls.

items.title: Gold and Silver Prices This Evening: Yellow metal surges by Rs 2,800 — Will precious metals hit new highs this wedding season?
items.summary: The rise in the prices of gold and silver was quite significant today, indicating the revival of consumer demand and optimistic market sentiment.

items.title: NPCI and BENEFIT launch real-time remittances between India and Bahrain
items.summary: Under the pact, India’s UPI will connect with Bahrain’s EFTS, specifically, Fawri+ service, allowing users in both countries to send and receive money instantly and securely

items.title: Tata Motors CV stock to list on November 12
items.summary: “The equity shares of the Company are scheduled to be listed for trading on the Stock Exchanges on November 12, 2025,”  mentions a communication from the Tata Group

items.title: Britannia MD & CEO Varun Berry resigns after a decade at helm
items.summary: Britannia Industries Ltd. announced on Monday, November 10, that Varun Berry has resigned from his positions as Executive Vice Chairman, Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer.

items.title: Vodafone Idea Q2 Results: Loss narrows to Rs 5,524 crore vs Q1, ARPU improves by Rs 3
items.summary: Vodafone Idea Q2 FY26 Earnings: Private sector telecom service provider Vodafone Idea has reported its financial results for the fiscal second quarter. Its average revenue per user has improved by Rs 14 sequentially.

items.title: Radisson Hotels to expand footprint at leisure destinations, airports
items.summary: The Collection hotel — RHG’s largest hotel in India yet by number of keys —  is being developed by Hill Crest Hotels & Resorts

items.title: Jindal Stainless net up 33% on higher sales volume
items.summary: Through misuse of the FTA route, imports from China and Vietnam continue to flood the market, distorting the level playing field for Indian producers, especially MSMEs, Abhyuday Jindal added

items.title: Brazil central bank tightens rules for virtual assets, cryptocurrency
items.summary: BRAZIL-CENTRAL-BANK-REGULATION:Brazil central bank tightens rules for virtual assets, cryptocurrency

items.title: Defence PSUs lead India’s Defence production at ₹1.51 Lakh crore: Rajnath Singh
items.summary: Private sector share in defence output rose from 21% to 23% in FY5

items.title: Demat accounts hit 10-month high in October: Thinking of opening one? Here’s what you should know
items.summary: Demat account openings in India rose sharply to a 10-month high in October, crossing 30 lakh new registrations amid strong IPO activity and a rebound in market sentiment. The total number of demat accounts now stands at 21 crore.

items.title: Vodafone Idea narrows loss in Q2, survival hinges on government relief
items.summary: A decline in expenses, especially finance costs, which include interest payments on debt and other liabilities, helped Vodafone Idea beat expectations.

items.title: Tariffs on copper are not safeguard measures: US on India's claim in WTO
items.summary: The US has rejected India's claim that its 50% copper tariffs are WTO safeguard measures, stating no basis for India's proposed duty suspension on American goods. Washington asserts the tariffs, imposed August 1, are national security measures under Section 232, aiming to reduce foreign dependence on critical copper imports.

items.title: Britannia’s Varun Berry resigns; Rakshit Hargave named new MD and CEO
items.summary: India's Britannia Industries said on Monday that managing director and chief executive officer Varun Berry has resigned, while the recently appointed chief, Rakshit Hargave, will now serve as both MD and CEO.

items.title: Breathless air ahead: Delhiites rush to add 'air-purifying' plants to shopping carts, demand surges as AQI worsens
items.summary: As Delhi's air quality turns hazardous, residents are flocking to nurseries for air-purifying plants. Varieties like Areca Palm, Snake Plant, and Peace Lily are in high demand. Nurseries report doubled sales as people seek natural ways to improve indoor air. Experts confirm these plants absorb pollutants and release oxygen, offering a green solution to urban pollution.

items.title: PXIL appoints Vivek Singla as Managing Director & CEO
items.summary: Singla has rich and diverse experience of over 35 years across the entire spectrum of the power sector, including Generation, Transmission, Distribution, Power Management, Renewable Power and Green Energy

items.title: Vodafone Idea Q2 Results: Net loss narrows to  ₹5,524 crore; ARPU rises to  ₹180
items.summary: Vodafone Idea reported a net loss of  ₹5,524.2 crore for the September quarter, an improvement from  ₹7,176 crore last year. Revenue rose 2.4% to  ₹11,194.7 crore, with EBITDA at  ₹4,685.1 crore and an ARPU of  ₹180, exceeding estimates.

items.title: A Square Capital to launch $40 mn VC fund, targets healthcare, tech, consumer sectors
items.summary: The fund will be sector-agnostic, but plans to place a strong emphasis on healthcare, technology, deep tech, artificial intelligence, fintech, and consumer brands, aiming to offer extensive end-to-end support to founders beyond just capital.

items.title: Britannia announces leadership transition: Varun Berry steps down
items.summary: The Board has appointed Rakshit Hargave as Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer effective December 15, 2025

items.title: Long-term bonds may offer the next big opportunity: Time to lock in?
items.summary: The 10-year benchmark yield stands at around 6.45%–6.55%, while longer maturities in the 13–15 year range offer yields of 6.86%–6.9%. This pickup over the benchmark makes it attractive, particularly as inflation stays contained and the RBI edges closer to a rate-cutting cycle.

items.title: Three years on, Akasa progressively moves to multi-gateway network
items.summary: Akasa Air advances its multi-gateway network strategy, enhancing connectivity and planning international expansions three years post-launch

items.title: Aerospace, defence supplier Rossell Techsys plans ₹300 cr capital infusion via QIP
items.summary: To facilitate the fundraise, the company has initiated a postal ballot seeking shareholder approval, with e-voting scheduled from November 4 to December 3, 2025

items.title: India's unemployment rate eases to 5.2% in September quarter, women's employment rises
items.summary: India's unemployment rate saw a decrease to 5.2 percent in the July to September quarter. This improvement was largely due to more jobs in rural areas during the farming season. Female participation in the workforce also increased. Rural unemployment dropped while urban unemployment saw a slight rise. The overall labor force participation rate edged up.

items.title: India trade delegation to visit Moscow as US tariffs hit exports
items.summary: Indian exporters are visiting Moscow this week. This visit aims to find new markets for Indian goods. It comes as US tariffs increase and Indian exports to the US decline. Russia is seen as a key partner with potential for growth. Indian companies will showcase their engineering products at an expo.

items.title: Varun Berry steps down as Britannia Industries' CEO and MD
items.summary: Varun Berry has stepped down from his leadership roles at Britannia Industries. He resigned on November 6, 2025, with his exit effective November 10, 2025. Berry led the company for a decade, overseeing its growth and diversification into dairy and snacking. His departure marks the end of an era for a prominent consumer goods leader.

items.title: JK Tyre to pump in Rs 5,000 crore for capacity boost, eyes new export markets
items.summary: JK Tyre & Industries is planning a significant Rs 5,000 crore investment over the next 5-6 years to boost production capacity for both car and truck tires. This expansion aims to capitalize on global market opportunities, with a revised export strategy focusing on new markets and diverting shipments from the US due to high tariffs.

items.title: Germany’s Bernhard Schulte buys 6 floors of office space in Mumbai
items.summary: Global maritime major Bernhard Schulte Shipmanagement has acquired office space in Mumbai for over Rs 304 crore. This marks a significant acquisition by an international shipping group in India. The new office will serve as the company's India headquarters. It will consolidate ship-management, crewing, technical, and digital operations. The space is scheduled for completion by December 2027.

items.title: Kunafa chocolates, Thekua & protein bars replace traditional sweets this festive season: GoKwik
items.summary: India's festive shopping saw a shift this year as Kunafa chocolates, Bihari Thekua, and protein bars replaced traditional sweets. Driven by nostalgia, viral trends, and wellness, chocolate sales surged, while regional and global influences reshaped online gifting. Health-conscious consumers opted for protein bars, indicating a growing wellness focus during festivals.

items.title: Novo Nordisk bets on Emcure to win India’s weight-loss drug war
items.summary: Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk has teamed up with Emcure Pharmaceuticals to increase access to its weight-loss drug semaglutide in India, introducing it as a second brand, Poviztra. The collaboration aims to enhance accessibility in the competitive anti-obesity market.

items.title: Stock markets snap three-day decline on buying in IT stocks; Sensex jumps 319 points
items.summary: The 30-share BSE Sensex benchmark climbed 319.07 points, or 0.38%, to close at 83,535.35, and the NSE Nifty advanced 82.05 points, or 0.32%, to settle at 25,574.35

items.title: JK Tyre looks to pump in ₹5,000-cr investment over 6 yrs to bolster production capacity
items.summary: The company introduced India's first embedded smart tyres for passenger vehicles, is currently in the process of investing ₹4,000 crore to ramp up its manufacturing infrastructure

items.title: Sensex, Nifty snap three-day losing streak; IT, defence & pharma stocks power rebound
items.summary: Sensex ended 319.07 points or 0.38% higher at 83,535.35, hitting an intraday high of 83,754.49; Nifty 50 settled with 82.05 points or 0.32% gains at 25,574.35

items.title: Anant Raj Ltd targets Data Center capacity of 117 MW by FY28, Q2 PAT up 30%
items.summary: Anant Raj Ltd said the expansion of capacity at it’s Data Centers in Manesar and Panchkula had strengthened its presence in Data Center business as both facilities could act as “Data Center and Disaster Recovery” to each other.

items.title: EEPC India urges inclusion of steel in US trade talks, seeks status quo with EU
items.summary: The group has formally raised the exporting community’s concerns with the government’s FTA negotiating teams

items.title: Razorpay strengthens tech leadership, appoints ex-Google engineering head Prabu Rambadran as SVP Engineering
items.summary: Razorpay names Google engineering head Prabu Rambadran as SVP Engineering to enhance innovation and drive fintech transformation.

items.title: Rupee falls 6 paise to close at 88.71 against U.S. dollar
items.summary: At the interbank foreign exchange market, the rupee opened at 88.64 against the American currency and touched an intraday high of 88.64 and a low of 88.71 against the greenback during the day

items.title: Glenmark gets approval for nasal spray RYALTRIS in China
items.summary: The National Medical Products Administration of China has approved RYALTRIS Compound Nasal Spray for the treatment of allergic rhinitis in adults and children

items.title: Fintech SaaS player Lentra aims to grow revenues 4x in three years, plans IPO on hitting target
items.summary: MUFG Bank and Bessemer-backed Lentra is betting on AI to power its next phase of business growth. If the bet works, it could leave behind challenges of tepid demand for SaaS products, client concentration risk, and moderate scale—and set the ground for an IPO.

items.title: JK Tyre looks to pump in Rs 5,000 cr investment over 6 yrs to bolster production capacity
items.summary: JK Tyre & Industries plans to invest ₹5,000 crore over the next five to six years to expand production capacity, including new lines dedicated to exports, Chairman and Managing Director Raghupati Singhania said.

items.title: Mint Explainer | How India's FMCG companies navigated sales after structural GST changes
items.summary: The implementation of new GST rates disrupted India's FMCG sector in September, affecting sales across personal care and food categories. Companies anticipate a return to normalcy in demand by early November as inventory adjustments are completed.

items.title: Broker’s call: Aadhar Housing Fin (Buy)
items.summary: Mirae Asset

items.title: Zepto To Snitch: Top 10 Rising Startups Driving Delhi-NCR's Business Landscape
items.summary: Bengaluru-based Zepto, which employs at least 400 full-time staff in its Delhi office, has emerged as the top-ranking rising startup in the region.

items.title: Stepping away from the workstation? Cognizant says think again
items.summary: Cognizant has started a course to familiarize executives with workforce-management tools such as ProHance that track employees' time away from systems.&nbsp;

items.title: Rupee falls 6 paise to close at 88.71 against US dollar
items.summary: At the interbank foreign exchange market, the rupee opened at 88.64 against the American currency, and touched an intraday high of 88.64 and a low of 88.71 against the greenback during the day

items.title: Broker’s call: Arvind (Buy)
items.summary: Elara Capital

items.title: IPO-bound Wakefit in expansion mode; plans to open 117 new stores by FY28
items.summary: Wakefit plans to open 117 additional company-owned, company-operated regular stores, which comprises 67 in FY27 and 50 in FY28 across cities

items.title: Emami Q2 profit skids 29.7% at ₹148.35 crore, revenue falls 10%
items.summary: Trade channels and consumers deferred purchases in anticipation of lower MRPs consequent to GST reforms, while distributors focused on liquidating higher cost inventory, resulting in a short-term moderation in sales

items.title: Tobacco farmers decry exclusion from WHO conference ahead of COP11
items.summary: The Federation of All India Farmer Associations said the WHO Framework Convention on Tobacco Control secretariat had denied its requests to participate in the 11th Conference of the Parties (COP11), scheduled for November 17

items.title: OpenAI and Nvidia's circular deals are emblematic of a speculative bubble—A repeat of the dot-com era in the making?
items.summary: The AI revolution may be real, but its business model is, at present, speculative by design. Circular revenue loops have become common in the AI ecosystem—OpenAI's deals with Nvidia, AWS and others epitomize them. All signs point to a growing bubble, and as history shows, bubbles always pop.

items.title: Google, Meta & Microsoft scale back diversity data disclosures amid Trump-era anti-DEI push; Apple & Amazon publish
items.summary: Major US tech companies, including Google, Microsoft, and Meta, are halting the publication of diversity statistics, potentially obscuring the impacts of anti-DEI policies. This contrasts with peers like Apple and Amazon, which continue to share data.

items.title: GHCL partners with AuthBridge to strengthen supplier ESG compliance
items.summary: The collaboration will automate ESG data collection and verification, introduce ESG scoring into supplier evaluations, and align practices with global standards

items.title: Bajaj, Hero Moto, TVS make last ditch effort to delay anti-lock braking system rules
items.summary: Issues concerning the two-wheeler companies are the ability to scale up supply and the increase in costs that could follow. All eyes are now on the 11 November meeting with transport minister Gadkari

items.title: US container imports fall in October amid tariff-driven caution
items.summary: As holiday merchandise reaches store shelves and inventories remain well stocked, the National Retail Federation and Hackett Associates expect US imports to slow in November and December, likely dropping below the 2 million TEU mark

items.title: Shah launches digital apps for urban co-op banks, sets target of one UCB per town
items.summary: Urban cooperative credit sector has reduced its non-performing assets to 0.6% from 2.8% over the last two years, Shah said

items.title: Workmates Core2Cloud's ₹69.8-cr IPO to open on Tue
items.summary: The IPO will conclude on November 13; The equity shares are proposed to be listed on the BSE SME Platform, with a tentative listing date of November 18, the company said in a statement

items.title: Captain Polyplast Q2 net down 75%, bags new orders
items.summary: During the September quarter, the company received initial order for supply of 200 off-grid solar water pumps worth ₹6 crore from MSEDCL under the “Magel Tyala Saur Krishi Pump” Yojna

items.title: Andhra govt grants composite licence to Hindustan Zinc for tungsten, associated mineral block
items.summary: The state Industries and Commerce Department issued the licence for the mineral block spread over 308 hectares, located at Balepalyam village in Kanaganapalle mandal of Sri Sathyasai district

items.title: Night temperatures drop, severe cold wave seen over North-West as winter arrives
items.summary: North-East monsoon rain, thunderstorms confined to parts of Kerala, Lakshadweep, Tamil Nadu

items.title: Amit Shah launches digital apps for urban co-op banks, sets target of one UCB per town
items.summary: Union Cooperation Minister Amit Shah launched Sahakar Digi Pay and Sahakar Digi Loan apps for urban cooperative banks. Digital payment adoption is crucial for their survival. The minister urged for expansion, setting a target of one additional UCB in every town with over two lakh population within five years.

items.title: Highway Infrastructure Q2 PAT rises multi-fold, expects ₹200 cr of EPC projects in 2 years
items.summary: The infrastructure development and management company, which has a presence in tollway collection, EPC infra and real estate, has reported a net profit of ₹9.7 crore for the September quarter against ₹1.6 crore in the year-ago period

items.title: Chouhan asks agri scientists to develop high-quality millet seeds
items.summary: "The farmers are looking for crops which will give them better financial benefits; So, it is a challenge before us to make millet as a profitable crop so that the farmers can divert toward the cultivation of millets"

items.title: Saya Group repays Rs 1,500 crore debt, to focus on growth
items.summary: Saya Group has significantly reduced its debt, repaying Rs 1,500 crore to financial institutions over five years. The real estate developer now holds Rs 250 crore in outstanding debt. This financial restructuring positions Saya Group for expansion. The company is set to launch new projects, strengthening its presence in the luxury real estate market.

items.title: SIAM's Shailesh Chandra elected as first Indian President of OICA
items.summary: Shailesh Chandra, President of SIAM, has been elected as the new President of OICA, effective November 1, 2025, marking the first time an Indian leads the global automotive industry body. Chandra, a leader at Tata Motors, emphasized OICA's critical role in navigating the industry's transition towards sustainable and Net Zero mobility. Hildegard Müller of VDA was elected Vice President.

items.title: India engineers’ body urges govt to modernise navigation systems across major airports
items.summary: An electronic engineers' body at AAI has urged the government to prioritize modernizing airport navigation systems following recent air traffic control issues in Delhi. The association highlighted neglect of CNS infrastructure and over-reliance on outdated automation, calling for better deployment of trained engineers and incorporation of their technical inputs.

items.title: Knowledge Realty Trust records 1.8 million sq ft leasing in April–September
items.summary: Knowledge Realty Trust reported robust leasing of 1.8 million sq ft in H1 FY26, with a 29% spread and 92% portfolio occupancy. The REIT strengthened its balance sheet, raising Rs 6,200 crore via IPO and reducing interest costs. Revenue and NOI saw significant year-on-year increases, with the first distribution of Rs 690 crore declared.

items.title: Kapston Services net up 75% on new client addition
items.summary: Srikanth Kodali, Managing Director, Kapston Services said the company continued to deliver healthy growth across industries supported by new client acquisitions and deeper engagements with existing customers

items.title: Emami bets on winter comeback after GST-led slowdown
items.summary: Emami Limited expects a strong rebound in the second half of FY26, supported by improved trade sentiment and a favourable winter season. The FMCG major reported a 10% drop in Q2 revenue due to temporary disruptions from recent GST rate cuts but said lower tax rates will boost affordability and long-term demand.

items.title: JSW Steel output grows 9% to 25 LT in October
items.summary: The capacity utilisation of Indian operations was at 83 per cent, lower due to shutdown of Blast Furnace 3 (BF3) at Vijayanagar for upgradation of capacity to 4.5 MTPA from 3.0 MTPA

items.title: Emami Q2 PAT down 29.7% at ₹148.35 cr
items.summary: The company had reported consolidated profit after tax of ₹210.99 crore in the second quarter last fiscal

items.title: ITI Asset Management launches Specialized Investment Fund Diviniti
items.summary: The open-ended strategy will invest in listed equities and related instruments, including limited short positions through derivatives, in line with SEBI regulations

items.title: Sharad Malhotra appointed as MD of Nippon Paint India
items.summary: Malhotra will succeed Jon Tan as Managing Director, reporting to the Group's CEO, Wee Siew Kim

items.title: KPIT Technologies Q2 Results: Net profit dips 17% to ₹169 crore
items.summary: The company’s revenue from operations increased by 7.9 per cent to ₹1,587.71 crore in Q2 FY26, as compared to ₹1,471.41 crore in Q2 FY25

items.title: Wavar partners with KARD for Madhya Pradesh expansion
items.summary: Through this collaboration, Wavar and KARD will jointly implement IPM solutions across major agri belts of the State, with plans to impact over 1 lakh farmers in the first phase

items.title: Indian home is becoming a new battleground
items.summary: India's home appliance market is booming. Rising incomes and urbanisation are driving demand for modern appliances. Global investors and Indian conglomerates are actively acquiring stakes and launching new brands. This intense activity signals a new growth phase for the sector. Consumers can expect more choices and innovation as companies compete for a share of Indian homes.

items.title: SJVN Q2 net profit dips 30% to ₹308 cr; company looks to raise ₹1,000 cr
items.summary: SJVN Ltd saw a total income of ₹1,078.29 crore, down from ₹1,108.43 crore in the July-September period of FY25

items.title: Microsoft wants AI to crack Gen Alpha’s slang but can machines really decode their cryptic talk?
items.summary: AI can be trained to spot when an emoji turns from innocent to illicit, but it will always lag behind online slang which is constantly changing. The real challenge isn’t teaching machines to talk like kids—it’s getting adults to listen to them.

items.title: AVPL International, CSC e-Governance Services sign MoU to help rural enterprises
items.summary: Through this partnership, AVPL International will offer its ‘Viraj UAS’ agri drones, spare parts, and training programmes via CSC’s network of over five lakh village level entrepreneurs

items.title: BITS Pilani taps alumni at Nvidia, OpenAI to teach AI
items.summary: BITS Pilani is actively engaging its alumni from top global AI companies to teach Generative and Agentic AI courses to over 2,500 students. This initiative, alongside a curriculum overhaul and the introduction of new AI and Smart Systems programs, aims to equip students with cutting-edge industry knowledge and foster research-to-innovation.

items.title: Coconut oil firms up despite rise in copra arrivals
items.summary: Official sources, citing strong buyer interest and persistent supply concerns, attributed reasons for the prices to remain firm to increased export demand for coconuts due to shortage in producing countries such as Indonesia and Sri Lanka

items.title: Sharad Malhotra appointed as MD of Nippon Paint India
items.summary: Sharad Malhotra has been appointed as the new Managing Director of Nippon Paint India, a pivotal moment in the company's history as he becomes the first Indian in this role. Taking charge on December 1, 2025, Malhotra is set to lead not just at a national level but also in advancing Nippon Paint's ambitions in the global automotive aftermarket sector.

items.title: Akasa Air expects faster Boeing aircraft deliveries; to soon start international flights from Delhi
items.summary: Akasa Air is set to begin international flights from Delhi soon. The airline also anticipates quicker deliveries of Boeing aircraft. Currently operating 24 domestic and six international routes, Akasa Air plans to expand its global network. This expansion includes destinations like Singapore, Uzbekistan, Indonesia, and Vietnam.

items.title: Indian state refiners HPCL, MRPL buy 5 million barrels of US, Mideast oil: Report
items.summary: Indian refiners are scouting for alternatives after U.S. President Donald Trump imposed sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil, Russia’s two largest oil companies, in an attempt to pressure President Vladimir Putin to end the war in Ukraine.

items.title: Retail inflation likely to hit record low of 0.3% in October on falling food prices, base effect and GST cuts: Mint poll
items.summary: While headline inflation is expected to be ultra-low, economists warn that core inflation may have risen further to 4.5-4.7% in October, mainly because of the sharp rally in gold prices.

items.title: India turns net exporter of finished steel in October, govt data shows
items.summary:
India, the world's second-biggest crude steel producer,
imported 0.5 million metric tons in October, down 55.6% from a
year earlier

items.title: Fujiyama Power Systems to float ₹828 cr IPO on Nov 13
items.summary: The  IPO is a combination of a fresh issue of equity shares worth upto ₹600 crore and an Offer For Sale (OFS) of 10  lakh shares, valued ₹228 crore at the upper end, by promoters

items.title: Hero MotoCorp’s VIDA launches VX2 Go 3.4 kWh electric scooter variant
items.summary: Hero MotoCorp’s electric brand VIDA has launched the VX2 Go 3.4 kWh scooter, unveiled by Union Minister Nitin Gadkari. With a 100 km range, dual removable batteries, and a ₹1.02 lakh price tag, the new model expands VIDA’s VX2 lineup and reinforces its goal of making electric mobility more affordable for Indian households.

items.title: India's home sales value set to hit Rs 6.65 lakh cr in FY26 as luxury drives growth
items.summary: Indian real estate is set for a significant value surge. Homes worth Rs 6.65 lakh crore are projected for sale in FY 26, a 19% increase. This growth occurs even as unit sales remain steady. Higher apartment prices are driving this value expansion. Luxury and ultra-luxury segments are leading the demand. This trend signals a robust market performance.

items.title: Electric tractor sales barely take off even with state sops as farmer awareness remains low
items.summary: Only 26 electric tractors have been sold in India this fiscal year, compared to half a million diesel units, hindered by inadequate charging infrastructure and high costs. Sales remain low, particularly in key agricultural states, highlighting challenges in technology and adoption among farmers.

items.title: Paytm unveils all-new app with clean interface, AI features to enhance payment experience
items.summary: The revamped app is built around AI, allowing it to understand spending patterns, automatically organise transactions, and provide personalised insights

items.title: Akasa Air expects faster Boeing aircraft deliveries; to soon start international flights from Delhi
items.summary: “We will soon have international departures from Delhi,” Akasa Air Co-Founder and Chief Commercial Officer Praveen Iyer said

items.title: Harsh Goenka: Corporate boards must adapt to a geopolitically fraught world—It's here to stay
items.summary: For Indian companies, geopolitical shocks are no longer distant headlines—they reshape how companies operate. This calls for a rethink of traditional business strategies to account for constant geopolitical risk. The question boards face today is—how ready are they to navigate the world as it is?

items.title: Private jet returns to taxi bay at Kolkata airport after smoke billows from engine
items.summary: Smoke was observed billowing from a private jet's engine just before take-off at Kolkata airport on Monday. The pilot immediately returned the aircraft to the taxi bay for inspection. Following a thorough check that found no technical issues or fire, the jet was cleared for departure and took off shortly after 11 am.

items.title: NPCI arm, BENEFIT sign pact for faster remittances between India, Bahrain
items.summary: This linkage will connect India’s Unified Payments Interface (UPI) with Bahrain’s Electronic Fund Transfer System (EFTS), specifically, Fawri+ service, allowing users in both countries to send and receive money instantly and securely

items.title: India curtails more solar power as grid grapples with oversupply
items.summary: India's power grid faces significant challenges absorbing a surge in solar installations, leading to record curtailment rates. This mismatch between daytime solar supply and inflexible coal power generation highlights the urgent need for energy storage solutions to integrate renewables and meet evening demand. The situation threatens the nation's clean energy goals.

items.title: Alembic Pharmaceuticals gets USFDA nod for generic migraine treatment injection
items.summary: Alembic Pharmaceuticals has achieved a pivotal milestone with the final green light from the US health authority for its generic Sumatriptan autoinjector. This achievement signifies the company's inaugural foray into drug-device combo products, aimed at alleviating the agonizing symptoms of migraines and cluster headaches.

items.title: Non-fossil power generation nears one-third of India’s total electricity output
items.summary: Non-fossil power sources accounted for 31.3% of India’s electricity generation in April–September 2025, up from 27.1% a year earlier, CEA data showed. With capacity crossing 250 GW, India is halfway to its 2030 clean energy target.

items.title: Mid-market: Sensex rallies 550 pts, Nifty tops 25,600; Grasim, Infosys, HCL Tech & Wipro lead gainers
items.summary: Infosys, Grasim, HCL Tech, Asian Paints, and Wipro topped Nifty gainers, while Trent, Tata Consumer, Max Health, Apollo Hospitals and Eternal were major losers

items.title: Apollo 24|7 partners with L'Oreal to bring La Roche-Posay brand to India
items.summary: Apollo 24|7 has teamed up with L'Oreal to introduce the renowned skincare brand La Roche-Posay to India. This partnership ensures Indian consumers can now access La Roche-Posay's science-backed products through Apollo's extensive online and offline network, including over 6,900 pharmacy stores. This move aims to bring world-class dermatological beauty solutions closer to every Indian doorstep.

items.title: IndusInd Bank rebuilding teams with 'high-integrity professionals,' MD and CEO Rajiv Anand says
items.summary: IndusInd Bank MD and CEO Rajiv Anand said the bank is rebuilding its culture by hiring “high-integrity professionals” across key roles, including a new CFO, internal audit head, general counsel and chief risk officer. The overhaul aims to strengthen governance and controls as the bank targets improved performance by FY27.

items.title: FAIFA flays WHO-FCTC COP11 for barring tobacco farm representatives

items.title: Share Market Highlights 7th November 2025: Sensex, Nifty fall for 3rd day dragged by foreign fund outflows, weak global peers
items.summary: Sensex, Nifty, Share Price Highlights: Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty ended lower on Friday as relentless foreign fund outflows and weak trends in global markets hit investors' sentiment. The 30-share BSE Sensex declined 94.73 points, or 0.11%, to settle at 83,216.28. The 50-share NSE Nifty dipped 17.40 points, or 0.07%, to 25,492.30. From the Sensex firms, Bharti Airtel tumbled 4.46% after Singtel said it has sold about 0.8% stake in the firm for ₹10,353 crore (SGD 1.5 billion). Tech Mahindra, Trent, Reliance Industries, HCL Tech, Hindustan Unilever, and ITC were also among the laggards.
